intro: Sphenopus divaricatus var. ehrenbergii, commonly known as the Ehrenberg's sphenopus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically important species.
